title: Most missed place
review: Right from the hustle and bustle of the Pushkar late temple is this temple, which will take you through narrow lanes. Classical old temple and you can see the incarnation of Lord vishnu. However, the priest may no attention to you nor bother you to tell the importance of this place

title: beautiful temple located in local pushkar market
review: Varha temple is so beautiful and close to pushkar ghat and local pushkar market and this temple devotee to lord vishnu.

title: vishnu's avatar
review: story of hindu trinity -  brahma, vishnu and mahesh is best summed up in varah avatar from vishnu's dashavatar (10 incarnations) mentioned in bhagavat purana..this temple signifies the same but is not maintained well

title: Vishnu temple
review: An old temple dedicated to the the Varah avatar of Lord Vishnu which is one other the 10 incarnations of him as per Hindu mytholodgy.

title: beautiful architect at varaha temple.
review: i like a architect of varaha temple, very close to city center, so when we go to the pushkar local market that time we visit a this major monument of pushkar

title: The place which is lost
review: I asked a lot of people about this temple. Even the locals did not know

title: Nothing outstanding
review: The temple is considered one of the most ancient in Pushkar, beautiful and popular among locals and tourists alike. However, the antiquity of it is questionable – it was destroyed several times, ranging from Mohammed Ghazni to Aurangzeb, so the current version actually stands here less than three centuries. The popularity of the temple?  I feel it – when I inspected the temple having climbed the steep stairs up, I was alone. As to the  beauty – well,  there are some decorative details like columns, sculptures, carvings and even the idol of Vishnu (the temple is consecrated to this god) in the form of a wild boar. However, no more than in a vast majority of Indian temples.

title: Nice architure
review: Renovation going on , currently most of temple premise is dirty but hopefully once renovation completes it will be a good architecture spot.

title: Awesome religious place
review: Its an very ancient temple in Pushkar. Basically its a Lord Vishnu temple. Place was really peaceful and calm. Will surly visit next time.

title: Beautiful temple of Sri Varaha - one of the incarnation of Lord Vishnu
review: Lovely temple with calm surroundings...taken care by the family lineage who live around the temple...definitely visit this temple to have darshan of the beautiful white marble statue of Sri Varaha murthy

title: Good worth to visit
review: A temple for hinduism the best and perfectly maintained and the wall were speak eveything about the temple. It is on the way to next ajmer so we had enough time to visit and was good.

title: "Lord Vishnu Temple"
review: Varaha Temple is dedicated to  Lord Vishnu ,very antique temple,feeling so excited here,nice architecture.

title: Small but beautiful
review: After reading the reviews here about this temple, unknowingly I reached near this temple while visiting the shiva temple nearby.But nothing amazing to see there as one temple of Barah in Khajuraho is more beautiful than this temple.The statue of lord Barah, though a small one but looks beautiful.You have to climb 10-20 stairs to reach the temple.

title: Varaha Temple visit
review: This is a temple of half lion incarnation of Vishnu which Vishnu took to kill a demon Hiranyakashyap.

title: Small temple off the beaten path
review: It is a very old temple that is not located directly on the lake.  This makes it less visited and very peaceful.  You can enjoy it without being hassled.  A very unique avatar of Lord Vishnu.

title: Oldest temple of the lord vishnu depicting his varah avatar
review: This temple was built in the 12 th century by king Anaji Chauhan. This is dedicated to the lord vishnu's varah avatar (incarnation of lord vishnu in form of wild boar). The emple houses the idol of the lord varah painted in white.

title: Most ancient temple
review: This is a medium sized and ancient temple in Pushkar.  Quite popular with tourists, it is dedicated to Lord Vishnu's third incarnation -Varaha or boar.  It was constructed in the 12th century. . Worth visiting

title: A little disappointing
review: It's an odd temple. It's peaceful, but I wouldn't say it's particularly beautiful or even all that interesting, which surprised me as temples dedicated to Varaha are certainly rare. It wasn't as well maintained as many other temples in the area.

title: Small but worth visiting
review: One of the few temples dedicated to Varaha, a reincarnation of lord vishnu it is situated near the main market of pushkar. It is a very small temple and can be visited till 8-9 pm at night. There is a series of steps before the gateway just in front of the temple.

title: beautiful temple
review: that temple is so beautiful and desigen and art work of this builing is so nice and this is devotte to lord vishnu and lord varha temple

title: Colourful Temple
review: The well crafted & colourful temple of Vishnu depicts all His Avatars. It serves curd rice for Prasad, which in itself is very tasty

title: Antique
review: This is the oldest temple of the area and I was astonished to see that hardly 1/100 of the visitors visit there. this temple is dedicated to lord Vishnu who came on earth for the killing of Hirnayakshyap in the form of Varah. The temple is not maintained and it must be taken over by the ASI for betterment. Must visit for religious and spiritual purposes.

title: Ancient temple of Lord Vishnu Varaha Avtar
review: Lord Vishnu's Varaha Avtar temple is very ancient and we walked through narrow streets from Pushkar lake to reach the temple in the evening. There is not enough lighting in the temple. Seeing the stature of the temple it seemed to be one of the big temples in olden days. But now it is not maintained properly. There is no crowd and our family is the only visitors when we went. We had a peaceful worship and spent some quiet time in the temple.

title: A regular temple for the devotees
review: There are many temples in Pushkar. This is a nice temple but nothing out of the ordinary. Since there is not much to see in pushkar during the non MELA days. It can be visited.

title: Lord Vishnu's rare temple - Varaha Avatar (Wild Boar incarnation)
review: This is a rare temple of Lord Vishnu dedicated to His Varaha Avatar (Wild boar incarnation) - third Avatar in the Dashavatar in Satya yuga. It is very old temple and might have been a big and important temple in ancient age. But now it seems to have lost its importance and is not maintained properly. As I have short listed this temple through online sites before our Ajmer-Pushkar visit, we went searching for the same. It is 10 minutes walk from Lord Brahma temple through lanes. Not many visitors are there and we had a peaceful dharshan of Lord. Must visit temple in Pushkar.

title: Vibrant and Exciting
review: Another temple in the area which is fantastic to enjoy the general energy of Pushkar. It's really vibrant and a great place to soak up the culture.

title: Temple of Lord Vishnu
review: Varaha Temple is dedicated to Varaha- 3rd incarnation of Lord Vishnu and having a big idol of Varaha in temple. The temple was built by King Anaji Chauhan and was desroyed by Emeror Aurngzeb in 1727 and reconstructed by Raja Savai Mansinh of Jaipur. A nice tmple.

title: Shweta Varaha beckons you to come visit
review: The old temple has a Shweta Varaha with Sri Bhumi devi. A rare temple. The temple history states was constantly destroyed by the Mughal emperor Aurangazeb. the temple still stands beautifully even though it is a family managed and would do well with more monetary backing. It is accessible by autos from any part of Pushkar

title: Antique Temple
review: The Temple was so old and so beautiful evening time culture activity is very nice. its is very approachable to Pushkar Local market priest and people who work in temple they are very helpful.

title: Clean and historic
review: An amazing place to relax and meditate. The temple is well managed by the management. Good to see such a calm place.

title: Not a tourist place
review: Nice simple temple needs an uplift. Varaha temples are rare. The darshan was good and satisfying. The whole place needs an urgent uplift. There is nothing touristy, but a good temple nevertheless. We spotted a snake emerging from one of the holes in the outer wall. Avoid in the evening.

title: A Rare Temple maintained poorly.
review: As we find very less  temples for this Varaha Avatara I went there to have a darshan.  It is a Big temple but maintained poorly.  Of course it needs money and due to lack of visiting pilgrims and offerings how it can be more than that.  So visiting to this temple is not a must.

title: Good temple
review: Granted, the temple is not easily visible, nor so popular as the Brahma temple (and thank God for it!). But it loped really serene and the priest was very absorbed in his prayers, which is a welcome change from the money-snatching, intimidating pandas that we encounter elsewhere in the country.

title: peacefull and less touristic
review: Varaha Temple is not well maintained but interesting and in peaceful surrounding. personaly, i like its a bit worn-out and raw presence. less people get there so you can enjoy quiet atmosphere of the place.

title: beautiful architect at varaha temple.
review: i like a architect of varaha temple, very close to city center, so when we go to the pushkar local market that time we visit a this major monument of pushkar
